channel.title: Gartner it
channel.description: Daily update of the featured news and research from Gartner it, the world's leading IT research and advisory firm.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2004 Gartner, Inc. and/or its Affiliates. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: U.K. Mobile Services: A Saturated But Changing Market - Feature
item.description: Operators hopes of generating additional revenue from third-generation (3G) services have not been helped by the regulator’s proposal to deregulate spectrum allocation.

item.title: Fresh Strategies for Customer Relationship Management - Feature
item.description: In 2005, many companies will expect their CRM applications to drive up revenue. We show you how to prepare to meet this need.

item.title: Siebel Expands SOA-Based Capabilities With IBM - news
item.description: Siebel Systems will advance its platform with service-oriented architecture (SOA) composite applications in the IBM technology environment, and with more complete SOA-oriented business process management capabilities.

item.title: JDeveloper, Eclipse Moves Should Boost Oracle Middleware Stack - news
item.description: Oracle plans to make JDeveloper free and provide greater support for Eclipse. These moves should help Oracle's Fusion Middleware technology stack gain broader acceptance.

item.title: T-Mobile's Google Deal Signals the End of the Mobile Portal - news
item.description: T-Mobile has opted for Google as the default home page on new handsets and de-emphasized its t-zones portal. Other operators will follow this important step toward merging the Internet and mobility.

item.title: Apple iTunes 4.9 Will Help Make Podcasting Mainstream - news
item.description: Apple's iTunes 4.9 software strengthens Apple's competitive position by allowing consumers to better manage &uot;podcasts.&uot; The new technology also makes podcasts more attractive to content providers and Web portals.

item.title: Why Local-Loop Unbundling Matters for European Businesses - research
item.description: European countries vary in their approach to opening up local telecom loops to competition, and in the progress they have made. This has big implications for the availability of low-cost, innovative broadband services.

item.title: What Metadata Is and Why You Should Care, 2H05 Through 1H06 - research
item.description: Metadata management is critical for enabling and supporting many key enterprise initiatives, including service-oriented development of applications. You can't track all possible metadata, so you'll need policies, procedures and standards.

item.title: An SOA Approach Will Boost a Bank's Competitiveness - research
item.description: Banks that are moving toward service-oriented architectures for core processing systems will be positioning themselves for future speed and agility. SOA's &uot;code once, use many times&uot; mode is becoming a key requirement for the future.

item.title: New Video Service Moves Google Ahead of Competitors - research
item.description: The launch of Google Video Search is a sign of the search giant's commitment to building the infrastructure to serve video content to users. Content owners should begin experimenting with the service now.
